intro: Brachyotum campii, commonly known as the Camp's brachyotum, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, designed to store water, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. Brachyotum campii is well-suited to low-water conditions and thrives in full sun.
